bibl.title: Calendrica II: Date Equations from the Reign of August.
bibl.note: 1. Introduction. - 2. Astronomical evidence for calendars. - 3. Text, interpretation, and dating of the ephemeris [P. Oxy. LXI, 4175, a Greek astronomical table that provides us with secure date equations in 24 B.C.]. - 4. Lunar longitudes and calendrical data in the ephemeris.
bibl.seg: JONES Alexander, Calendrica II: Date Equations from the Reign of August.

1. Introduction. - 2. Astronomical evidence for calendars. - 3. Text, interpretation, and dating of the ephemeris [P. Oxy. LXI, 4175, a Greek astronomical table that provides us with secure date equations in 24 B.C.]. - 4. Lunar longitudes and calendrical data in the ephemeris.
